title: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The first book in the Lord of the Rings trilogy

title: The Two Towers
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The second book in the Lord of the Rings trilogy

title: The Return of the King
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The third book in the Lord of the Rings trilogy

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The prequel to the Lord of the Rings trilogy

title: The Silmarillion
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The history of Middle Earth

title: Trainspotting
author: Irvine Welsh
description: A novel about heroin addiction

title: Porno
author: Irvine Welsh
description: A sequel to Trainspotting that follows the characters’ involvement in the pornography industry

title: Skagboys
author: Irvine Welsh
description: A prequel to Trainspotting that depicts the origins of the characters’ drug addiction

title: The Acid House
author: Irvine Welsh
description: A collection of short stories that explore various aspects of Scottish life and culture

title: Glue
author: Irvine Welsh
description: A novel that follows the lives of four friends from Edinburgh over four decades

title: Life on Earth
author: David Attenborough
description: A book that accompanies the television series of the same name that explores the diversity of life on Earth

title: The Private Life of Plants
author: David Attenborough
description: A book that accompanies the television series of the same name that reveals the secrets of plant life and behavior

title: Blue Planet
author: David Attenborough
description: A book that accompanies the television series of the same name that showcases the wonders and challenges of life in the oceans

title: Planet Earth
author: David Attenborough
description: A book that accompanies the television series of the same name that depicts the natural beauty and diversity of Earth’s habitats and wildlife

title: A Life on Our Planet
author: David Attenborough
description: A book that reflects on David Attenborough’s personal experiences and observations of nature and offers a vision for a sustainable future for humanity and the planet

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
description: The first book in the Foundation series that follows the efforts of a group of scientists to preserve civilization after the fall of the Galactic Empire

title: I,Robot
author: Isaac Asimov
description: A collection of short stories that explore the ethical and social implications of robotics and artificial intelligence

title: The Caves of Steel
author: Isaac Asimov
description: The first book in the Robot series that features a detective and a humanoid robot who must solve a murder mystery in a futuristic city

title: The Gods Themselves
author: Isaac Asimov
description: A novel that deals with the consequences of an exchange of matter and energy between parallel universes

title: The End of Eternity
author: Isaac Asimov
description: A novel that follows a time traveler who falls in love with a woman from a different era and decides to alter history for her sake

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A novel that follows a family who moves into a haunted hotel and becomes tormented by supernatural forces

title: It
author: Stephen King
description: A novel that follows a group of friends who are terrorized by a shape-shifting entity that feeds on their fears

title: Carrie
author: Stephen King
description: A novel that follows a teenage girl who develops telekinetic powers and takes revenge on her abusive peers and mother

title: Pet Sematary
author: Stephen King
description: A novel that follows a family who discovers a mysterious burial ground that can resurrect the dead with horrific consequences

title: Salem’s Lot
author: Stephen King
description: A novel that follows a writer who returns to his hometown and finds it infested by vampires

author: George Orwell
description: A novel that depicts a totalitarian society where the government controls every aspect of life and manipulates reality through propaganda and surveillance

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: A novel that uses farm animals as allegories for the events of the Russian Revolution and the rise of Stalinism

title: Homage to Catalonia
author: George Orwell
description: A book that recounts George Orwell’s personal experiences and observations during the Spanish Civil War

title: Keep the Aspidistra Flying
author: George Orwell
description: A novel that follows a young man who quits his job as an advertising copywriter and struggles with poverty and social expectations in London

title: Burmese Days
author: George Orwell
description: A novel that depicts the life of a British colonial officer in Burma and his conflicts with imperialism and racism

title: Murder on the Orient Express
author: Agatha Christie
description: A novel that features Hercule Poirot who investigates a murder on a train that is stranded by a snowstorm

title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie
description: A novel that follows ten strangers who are invited to an isolated island and are killed one by one according to a nursery rhyme

title: The Murder of Roger Ackroyd
author: Agatha Christie
description: A novel that features Hercule Poirot who solves the murder of a wealthy man in a small village with an unexpected twist

title: Death on the Nile
author: Agatha Christie
description: A novel that features Hercule Poirot who investigates a murder on a cruise ship on the Nile River involving a love triangle

title: A Pocket Full of Rye
author: Agatha Christie
description: A novel that features Miss Marple who solves the murder of a businessman and his family members using clues from a nursery rhyme

title: Oliver Twist
author: Charles Dickens
description: A novel that follows the life of an orphan boy who escapes from a workhouse and joins a gang of pickpockets in London

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: A novel that tells the story of Pip,a young orphan who becomes a gentleman with the help of a mysterious benefactor and falls in love with an unattainable woman

title: David Copperfield
author: Charles Dickens
description: A novel that depicts the personal and professional struggles of David Copperfield,from his childhood to his adulthood,as he faces poverty,abuse,betrayal and romance

title: The Time Machine
author: H.G. Wells
description: A novel that features a Victorian scientist who travels to the year 802,701 and encounters two races of human descendants: the peaceful Eloi and the subterranean Morlocks

title: The War of the Worlds
author: H.G. Wells
description: A novel that features a Martian invasion of England and the struggle of humanity to survive against their superior technology and ruthless methods

title: The Island of Dr. Moreau
author: H.G. Wells
description: A novel that features a shipwrecked sailor who discovers a remote island where a mad scientist experiments on animals and creates hybrid creatures with human traits and intelligence

title: The Invisible Man
author: H.G. Wells
description: A novel that features a scientist who invents a way to change his body’s refractive index and becomes invisible,but also becomes mentally unstable and violent

title: The Shape of Things to Come
author: H.G. Wells
description: A novel that features a history of the future from 1933 to 2106,written by a man who claims to have seen it in a dream induced by a drug

title: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A novel that features a hapless Earthling who escapes the planet’s destruction with an alien friend and embarks on a hilarious intergalactic adventure

title: The Restaurant at the End of the Universe
author: Douglas Adams
description: A novel that features the continuing adventures of Arthur Dent and his companions as they travel across space and time,encounter a super-intelligent shade of blue,and dine at a place where they can witness the end of all things

title: Life,the Universe and Everything
author: Douglas Adams
description: A novel that features Arthur Dent and his friends as they try to prevent a galactic war between two factions of aliens who are obsessed with cricket

title: So Long,and Thanks for All the Fish
author: Douglas Adams
description: A novel that features Arthur Dent’s return to Earth after its miraculous restoration and his romance with a girl who can talk to dolphins

title: Mostly Harmless
author: Douglas Adams
description: A novel that features Arthur Dent’s discovery of an alternate Earth where he has a daughter and his final encounter with his old friends before the ultimate fate of the universe
